docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 --President Joan-Goulart's lead ing foreign policy adviser proposed today that Cuba be neutralized and yield all her nuclear weapons in exchange for a nonaggression pledge from the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 27 --President Joan-Goulart's lead ing foreign policy adviser proposed today that Cuba be neutralized and yield all her nuclear weapons in exchange for a nonaggression pledge from the United States.
docs.abstract: Brazilian ex-Min Dantas proposes that Cuba give up all nuclear weapons in exch for US nonaggression pledge; also would require Cuba to be neutralized and to pledge not to try to subvert neighbors; defends Brazil's vote in OAS

headline.main: CUBA COMPROMISE URGED IN BRAZIL; Ban on Atom Weapons and Aggression Proposed

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Major foreign currencies showed a mixed reaction to the crisis caused by the Cuban situation. British pound sterling sold off on active dealings with the forward rates tightening their spreads with spot position. Canadian dollar continued to maintain...
docs.lead_paragraph: Major foreign currencies showed a mixed reaction to the crisis caused by the Cuban situation. British pound sterling sold off on active dealings with the forward rates tightening their spreads with spot position. Canadian dollar continued to maintain a firm undertone on light turnover.

headline.main: Swedish Girls in Mercedes Increase Lead in Argentina

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 29--U Thant, the Acting Secretary General, conferred today with the Soviet and United States envoys dealing with the Cuban crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 29--U Thant, the Acting Secretary General, conferred today with the Soviet and United States envoys dealing with the Cuban crisis.

headline.main: U.N. CHIEF CONFERS; Sees Soviet and U.S. Envoys--30 Aides to Accompany Him Thant Holds 'Fruitful' Talks on Cuban Issue With Stevenson and Kuznetsov at U.N. U.N. CHIEF TO FLY TO HAVANA TODAY He Will Take a Party of 30 With Him--Khrushchev Sends Best Wishes

headline.main: Roll-Call Vote in U.N. On Seat for Red China

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 31--Two Swedish girls smashed all of Argentina's road racing records today by winning the fourth successive leg of the 3,000-mile Grand Prix.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 31--Two Swedish girls smashed all of Argentina's road racing records today by winning the fourth successive leg of the 3,000-mile Grand Prix.

headline.main: Swedish Girl Drivers Set Argentina Race Records
